meta.seo_title: Free Anatomy and Physiology 2e Textbook for Download
meta.search_description: Learn about human anatomy and physiology online by downloading OpenStax's free Anatomy and Physiology 2e book and using our accompanying study guide.

title: Anatomy and Physiology 2e
description:
Anatomy and Physiology 2e is developed to meet the scope and sequence for a two-semester human anatomy and physiology course for life science and allied health majors. The book is organized by body systems. The revision focuses on inclusive and equitable instruction and includes new student support. Illustrations have been extensively revised to be clearer and more inclusive. The web-based version of Anatomy and Physiology 2e also features links to surgical videos, histology, and interactive diagrams. Please learn more about the changes by previewing the preface.

The first edition of Anatomy and Physiology by OpenStax is available in web view here.

If you have encountered a white screen while accessing your OpenStax textbook, our developers suggest closing all of your OpenStax.org tabs and then loading the book again.

book_student_resources.resource_description: Congratulations! You've got a free textbook. Download this guide to learn how to use it.
Adapted from OpenStax College Success, this guide discusses effective reading approaches, study tips, and notetaking strategies for students.
Need help studying? Access detailed solutions to problems and exercises in your OpenStax book.
book_student_resources.link_document_title: Anatomy and Physiology 2e - Student Solution Guide

book_student_resources.resource_description: Adapted from OpenStax College Success, this guide includes information about estimating time on tasks, avoiding procrastination, and using strategies to stick to your priorities.

book_faculty_resources.resource_description: Download our helpful guide to all things OpenStax.
The instructor solutions guide contains the instructor-facing answers to the problems and exercises within the textbook.
book_faculty_resources.link_document_title: Anatomy and Physiology 2e - Instructor Answer Guide

book_faculty_resources.resource_description: Let us make lectures a little easier for you. We’ve got PowerPoint slides with all the images from the book, organized by chapter.
This .ZIP contains many images from the book with their labels covered so that they can be used for quizzes and tests.

These resources contain chapter outlines with key concepts, terms, and questions. They are designed to provide a note-taking framework and enhance student understanding in reading and course sessions.

These guidelines support OpenStax efforts to ensure diverse representation in the development and improvement of our materials. These guidelines can be used to develop and improve all open educational resources.
book_faculty_resources.link_document_title: OpenStax Representation and Diversity Development Guidelines

book_faculty_resources.resource_description: OpenStax generates Docx files for each section of this textbook to provide an easy way for instructors who need to customize OpenStax content. The Docx files are converted automatically and may contain some conversion errors. These files are provided to instructors as a helpful resource, but the OpenStax website is the preferred method for students to access our books. Once these files are downloaded, they will no longer receive content updates from OpenStax. Docx files can be used in Microsoft Word, LibreOffice, OpenOffice, or uploaded to Google Docs by instructors for use there, if desired.
This summary of the key changes from 1e to 2e is designed to assist faculty in using the new edition.

value.content: And we've got resources that will help you ace your course.

community_resource_blurb: Members of the OpenStax community can join the Hub to share resources they've created to use with our anatomy and physiology book. Find resources and submit your own!

value.heading: Find a webinar
value.content: Learn more by attending one of our free webinars featuring OpenStax authors, staff, and partners.

rex_callout_blurb: New Highlight and add notes — it’s 100% free!
errata_content: All OpenStax textbooks undergo a rigorous review process. However, like any professional-grade textbook, errors sometimes occur. The good part is, since our books are web-based, we can make updates periodically. If you have a correction to suggest, submit it here. We review your suggestion and make necessary changes.
customization_form_subheading: Please select the modules (up to 10), that you want to customize with Google Docs.
customization_form_disclaimer:
Disclaimer

The following features and functionality are not available to teachers and students using Google Docs customized content:

  • Errata updates. OpenStax webview is updated at least twice yearly. Customized Google Docs will not receive these content updates.
  • Access to study tools. OpenStax webview has in-book search, highlighting, study guides, and more available for free. This functionality will not be available in Google Docs versions.
  • Formatting. Print books and webview have a specific design and structure format developed for those platforms. These functionalities are not available in the Google Docs versions.
customization_form_next_steps:
Next Steps

  1. Within two business days, you will receive an email for each module that you have requested access to customize.
  2. The link provided in the email will be your own copy of the Google Doc that OpenStax generated for you.
  3. Once you have accessessed the document you can make the changes you desire and share with your students. We recommend using the "Publish to the Web" functionality under the file menu for sharing with students.
support_statement: With philanthropic support, this book is used in classrooms, saving students dollars this school year. Learn more about our impact and how you can help.
